formula: a(n) = (f(n)+1) * phi(p^(k-1)) if 2 is primitive mod 2n-1 in which case necessarily 2n-1=p^k, p prime; otherwise, a(n) = lcm(f(n), f(n)+1), where f(n) = A002326(n-1). - _Sean A. Irvine_, Jul 17 2013
mathematica: f[n_] := MultiplicativeOrder[2, 2*n-1]; a[n_] := If[f[n] == EulerPhi[2*n-1], {p, k} = FactorInteger[2*n-1] // First; (f[n]+1)*EulerPhi[p^(k-1)], LCM[f[n], f[n]+1]]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 100}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Mar 06 2014, after _Sean A. Irvine_ *)
